channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: Latest remains returned to Israel from Gaza are not bodies of hostages, Israel says
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people handed over by Hamas to the Red Cross this week do not belong to any of the hostages, Israel said Saturday, the latest development that could undermine the U.S.-brokered agreement for a ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Pakistan partially reopens Torkham border crossing to allow Afghan refugees to leave
item.description: PESHAWAR, Pakistan (AP) — Pakistan on Saturday partially reopened the Torkham border crossing with Afghanistan to allow thousands of stranded Afghan refugees to return home, officials said. Restrictions remain on all other cross-border movement, including trade.
item.dc:creator: RIAZ KHAN, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Top diplomats from Germany, Jordan and the UK call for an immediate ceasefire in Sudan war
item.description: DUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — The foreign ministers of Germany, Jordan and the United Kingdom jointly called on Saturday for an immediate ceasefire in the war in Sudan, describing the situation there in stark, apocalyptic terms after a paramilitary force seized the last major city in the East A
item.dc:creator: JON GAMBRELL, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Heidi Klum reveals her much-anticipated 2025 Halloween costume
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Heidi Klum donned green scales and squirming snakes to transform herself into Medusa for Halloween on Friday.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Federal judge rules Trump can’t require citizenship proof on the federal voting form
item.description: NEW YORK (AP) — President Donald Trump’s request to add a documentary proof of citizenship requirement to the federal voter registration form cannot be enforced, a federal judge ruled Friday. U.S. District Judge Colleen Kollar-Kotelly in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and NICHOLAS RICCARDI, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Judges order SNAP funding to continue as shutdown threatens food assistance for many Illinois families
item.description: Two federal judges ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown, using contingency dollars if necessary, to ensure that the 2 million Illinoisans who rely on the program can access healthy food.
item.dc:creator: Julian Crews, WGN 9

item.title: Air traffic controller shortages lead to broader US flight delays as shutdown nears one-month mark
item.description: Travel delays were adding up at airports across the U.S. on Friday as the government shutdown drags on, putting even more pressure on air traffic controllers who have been working without pay for a month. U.S.
item.dc:creator: RIO YAMAT, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Monkey escape in Mississippi gives a glimpse into the secretive world of animal research
item.description: The recent escape of several research monkeys after the truck carrying them overturned on a Mississippi interstate is the latest glimpse into the secretive industry of animal research and the processes that allow key details of what happened to be kept from the public.
item.dc:creator: JEFF MARTIN, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Trump urged GOP-led states to redraw US House districts. Now other states also are gerrymandering
item.description: President Donald Trump's call for Republicans to redraw U.S. House districts ahead of next year's election has triggered an unusual outbreak of mid-decade gerrymandering among both Republican- and Democratic-led states.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump says he’s not considering strikes within Venezuela
item.description: President Trump on Friday said he was not considering strikes within Venezuela following reports his administration had identified potential military targets within the country.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, NewsNation

item.title: US Marine arrested, accused of traveling 'to meet, kidnap and sexually assault' 12-year-old girl: FBI
item.description: Active-duty Marine William Richard Roy arrested by FBI for allegedly traveling from North Carolina to Indiana to kidnap and assault a 12-year-old girl.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Judges order the Trump administration to use contingency funds for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two judges could rule as soon as Friday on whether President Donald Trump's administration must replenish SNAP food aid benefits for November despite the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Nation’s largest airlines press Democrats to pass funding stopgap to reopen government
item.description: Four of the nation’s largest airlines are pressing Senate Democrats to pass a clean stopgap spending bill to reopen the government amidst growing delays at airports around the country caused by staffing issues linked to the expiration of government funding a month ago.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Bolton, NewsNation

item.title: Escaped monkeys from Mississippi truck crash puts spotlight on NIH-funded Tulane lab
item.description: Three monkeys remain at large after truck crash in Mississippi released 21 primates from Tulane University research program allegedly funded by NIH, sparking public safety concerns.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 5 charged in overdose death of Robert De Niro's grandson
item.description: Sophia Marks, known as the "Percocet Princess," was previously charged with selling the drugs that caused the teen's death.
item.dc:creator: Mira Wassef, NewsNation

item.title: Judges order Trump administration to use emergency reserves for SNAP payments during the shutdown
item.description: Two federal judge have ruled that the Trump administration must continue to fund the SNAP food aid program using emergency reserve funds during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Michael Casey, Geoff Mulvihill And Kimberlee Kruesi, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, WGN 9

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WFLA, NBC

item.title: House Republicans grow anxious about Speaker Johnson's extended shutdown recess
item.description: House Republicans are growing anxious about how they will make up for lost time after Speaker Mike Johnson’s (R-La.
item.dc:creator: Emily Brooks, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Halloween threat puts kids in danger as drug-laced sweets spook parents, trick-or-treaters: expert
item.description: Police warn parents about drug-laced Halloween candy as THC and fentanyl treats disguised as popular brands threaten trick-or-treaters nationwide this year.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: Palestinian militants hand over remains of two more hostages to Red Cross in Gaza
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Hospital officials in Gaza say that Israel has handed over the bodies of 30 Palestinians. Friday's handover comes a day after Palestinian militants in Gaza turned over the remains of two hostages to Israel.
item.dc:creator: JULIA FRANKEL and WAFAA SHURAFA, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Chicago father of child fighting cancer released on bond by immigration judge
item.description: CHICAGO (AP) — A Chicago man whose 16-year-old daughter is undergoing treatment for advanced cancer will be released on bond and return home, an immigration judge ruled Thursday. Attorneys for Ruben Torres Maldonado, a 40-year-old painter and home renovator who was detained Oct.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE FERNANDO, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Cop's testimony, judge's instructions influenced outcome of Sonya Massey murder case
item.description: SPRINGFIELD, Ill. (AP) — The killing of Sonya Massey in her home by an Illinois sheriff's deputy was pursued by prosecutors as a first-degree murder case with a possible life prison sentence. Then the judge gave the jury another option when deliberations began this week.
item.dc:creator: JOHN O'CONNOR and ED WHITE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Top Intel Democrat rips Trump administration over exclusion from boat strike briefing
item.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — The Trump administration’s increasing efforts to exclude Democrats from national security briefings could endanger troops and keep important information from the public, the top Democrat on the Senate intelligence committee warned Thursday.
item.dc:creator: MARY CLARE JALONICK and JOEY CAPPELLETTI, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: King Charles III strips Prince Andrew of titles and evicts him from royal residence
item.description: King Charles III is stripping his brother Prince Andrew of his remaining titles and evicting him from his royal residence, Buckingham Palace said Thursday.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: Vance predicts holiday air travel will be 'a disaster' if shutdown does not end
item.description: Vice President Vance predicted Thursday that holiday air travel will be a “disaster” if the government shutdown does not end. “It could be a disaster,” Vance told reporters following a roundtable at the White House on how the shutdown is impacting airline travel.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Why you won't receive a Supplemental Security check on Nov. 1
item.description: October is nearly over, which means you may be checking your calendar to see when you'll receive your November Social Security benefits.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Maine network ends primary care after losing Medicaid due to Trump defunding Planned Parenthood
item.description: PORTLAND, Maine (AP) — A network of medical clinics that serves low-income residents in Maine said it will shut down its primary care operations on Friday because of Trump administration cuts to abortion providers.
item.dc:creator: PATRICK WHITTLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Trump, Xi agree to ease trade war in high-stakes meeting
item.description: President Donald Trump announced an agreement with Chinese President Xi Jinping to ease their trade war following a meeting Thursday, with the U.S. scaling back tariffs and China delaying export controls and resuming some soybean purchases.
item.dc:creator: Julia Manchester, Fox 5

item.title: California museum heist: Thieves steal over 1,000 items, including historical artifacts
item.description: The heist took place on the afternoon of October 15 at the Oakland Museum of California’s off-site storage facility, police said.
item.dc:creator: Amy Larson, Fox 5

item.title: Pulled pork sandwiches recalled over plastic contamination
item.description: The E.A. Sween Company announced this week that it is recalling a brand of its pulled pork sandwiches over concerns that there may be plastic pieces in them.
item.dc:creator: Jordan Perkins, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Hurricane Melissa expected to approach Bermuda today: NHC
item.description: TAMPA, Fla. (WFLA)— A Hurricane Warning is in effect for Bermuda as Hurricane Melissa is expected to approach the island later today and into tonight, the National Hurricane Center said.
item.dc:creator: Ashley Suter, WFLA, NBC

item.title: How to find food if your SNAP benefits are cut off
item.description: Unless something changes dramatically in the next couple days, more than 40 million Americans are preparing to have federal food assistance cut off starting Saturday.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, Fox 5

item.title: Video shows dramatic rescue of woman from car submerged in South Carolina pond
item.description: HORRY COUNTY, S.C. (WBTW) – Video obtained by Nexstar's WBTW shows South Carolina first responders and bystanders rescuing a woman from a car partially submerged in a pond along a highway bypass in Horry County Tuesday afternoon.
item.dc:creator: Dennis Bright, WGN 9

item.title: White House ousts arts commissioners expected to oversee ballroom, arch construction
item.description: The White House on Tuesday fired the members of the Commission of Fine Arts, a federal agency that advises on architectural developments in Washington, D.C.
item.dc:creator: Brett Samuels, Fox 5

item.title: Man deported to Laos despite court order blocking his removal, attorneys say
item.description: NEW ORLEANS (AP) — Immigration officials have deported a father living in Alabama to Laos despite a federal court order blocking his removal from the U.S. on the grounds he has a claim to citizenship, the man's attorneys said Tuesday. U.S. District Judge Shelly Dick last week ordered U.S.
item.dc:creator: JIM MUSTIAN and JACK BROOK, Associated Press, ABC 4
